alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Johnson County through 330 PM MDT... At 257 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Mayoworth, or 19 miles north of Kaycee, moving slowly to the southeast. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Johnson County. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 267 and 282. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Southeast Johnson County
